summary: This is an internal FBI email from July 8, 2019, regarding daily updates on call activity related to the Epstein case. It outlines categories for tracking calls from victims, witnesses, and other informants, and is sent from an FBI supervisor to the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad.

persons.name: ASAC
persons.context: Recipient of daily email updates summarizing call activity related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: SSA Squad C-20
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent of Squad C-20
persons.context: Author of the email, instructing that daily summaries of call activity be sent regarding victims, witnesses, and other informants in the Epstein case.

connections.description: SSA Squad C-20 is instructing that ASAC be included on daily email updates regarding the Epstein case.

locations.name: FBI New York office
locations.context: The office from which the email originates and where the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad is based.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively tracking call activity related to the Epstein case as of July 2019, categorizing calls from victims, witnesses, and other informants.
The email indicates an ongoing, organized effort by the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad to compile information daily.
The communication shows internal procedural coordination for case updates within the FBI's New York office.
